pr_title: [#2258] Specify the content-type of a telemetry/event message via MQTT property bag

timeline.message:
[#2258] Specify the content-type of a telemetry/event message via MQTT property bag

Signed-off-by: Kartheeswaran Kalidass <kartheeswaran.kalidass@bosch.io>

timeline.bodyText: What if I specify the content type using Content-Type?
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: Good point. Field names in HTTP headers  are case-insensitive. I think it makes sense also to treat the property names as case-insensitive in the MQTT property-bag.  WDYT?
replies.author: kaniyan

replies.bodyText: Now I have made it case insensitive and pushed the changes.
replies.author: kaniyan

timeline.message:
[#2258] Specify the content-type of a telemetry/event message via MQTT property bag

Signed-off-by: Kartheeswaran Kalidass <kartheeswaran.kalidass@bosch.io>

Incorporate feedback and minor improvements.

* Treat property names as case insensitive while retrieving the value of a property.
* Change the return type of the PropertyBag.topicWithoutPropertyBag() to ResourceIdentifier.
* Insert an empty line between a paragraph and the next section heading in MQTT adapter guide.
